thread.title: Crowder, Wiseman record 2 TDs in a game
thread.title_full: Crowder, Wiseman record 2 TDs in a game

title: Crowder, Wiseman record 2 TDs in a game
text:
Crowder, Wiseman record 2 TDs in a game By Mike Tupa mtupa@examiner-enterprise.com 
Former Bartlesville High School football standout Calan Crowder has proven to have a nose for the end zone for the Missouri State Bears. 
During the Bears’ game two weeks ago, Crowder burst past the goalline on two touchdown runs of two yards apiece, to help the Bears bolt ahead of Indiana State, 14-7. 
However, Indiana State roared back to win, 56-28. 
Crowder finished with 18 yards rushing on eight carriers, and snared five receptions for 23 yards, including a 17-yarder. 
In last week’s contest, Crowder didn’t rack up any stats in the Bears’ 73-26 loss to Southern Illinois. 
Jack Wiseman 
Crowder’s former Bartlesville Bruin backfield running mate Jack Wiseman proved again two weeks ago his talent for long touchdown runs. 
Wiseman broke loose on a 56-yard scoring gallop for Hillsdale College; he later scored on a one-yard plunge. 
But, his running and touchdown heroics weren’t quite enough, as Grand Valley State downed Hillsdale, 42-21. 
Wiseman rushed for 73 yards, on 12 carries, in the game. He also hauled in a catch for 12 yards. 
In last week’s 34-29 loss to Ohio Dominican, Wiseman either didn’t play or didn’t get any touches. 
Garrett Powell 
One-time Bartlesville High School receiver extraordinaire Garrett Powell helped Northeastern State University break a 17-game non-winning streak. 
Powell recorded one rush for 14 yards, and averaged nearly 40 yards per punt, during the RiverHawks’ 31-14 thumping of Nebraska-Kearney. 
In a recent 59-7 loss to Northwest Missouri, Powell fingered four receptions for 45 yards, his longest catch going for 23 yards. 
Sadie Schaffner 
Former Bartlesville High School cross country icon Sadie Schaffner has helped the Oral Roberts University spiker team to a winning (10-9) record through 19 matches. 
Schaffner — a front row player — has appeared in 47 of a possible 73 sets and contributed 59 kills, sixth most on the team. 
She also has made 24 digs and participated in 35 blocks, third most on the team. 
Colby Mitchell 
Former Bartlesville High School rock-solid lineman Colby Mitchell has started all five games at center this season for the University of Louisiana-Monroe. 
The Warhawks are 1-4 on the season, including last weekend’s 34-24 loss at Tulsa. 
Slade Nordic 
A Bartlesville High receiving/defensive back standout in the last few years is getting a chance to produce for Pittsburg State. 
Slade Nordic, a redshirt freshman, has grabbed two catches for 21 yards, including a 15 yarder. 
Andrew Rodgers 
Copan High School sports standout Andrew Rodgers — a former four-sport athlete during his prep years — recently helped the Pittsburg State men’s cross country team finished fourth at the Fort Hays State Tiger Open. 
Rodgers surged to 40 th place overall, with a time of 25:36.1, and to fourth place for the Gorilla team. Rules for posting comments
